name: formd
body:
# [`formd`](https://github.com/drbunsen/formd)—A Markdown formatting tool:

`formd` is a tool for (for)matting (M)ark(d)own that allows rapid conversion between the [two styles](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#link) of Markdown links and images—_inline_ and _referenced_. 

## Why is `formd` useful?   

Inline Markdown is difficult to read, but useful for writing and editing because the linked text and URLs are adjacent to the words you are writing. For example:
```markdown
The quick brown [fox](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox) jumped over 
the lazy [dog](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dog).
```
Referenced Markdown is awkward while writing because it requires jumping between links within the text and the reference section at the bottom of a document. However, referenced Markdown is the superior syntax for reading because URLs do not breakup the flow of words or sentences. For example:
```markdown
The quick brown [fox][] jumped over the lazy [dog][].  
```
`formd` provides the best of both worlds by allowing users to quickly toggle Markdown formats between inline while writing and referenced while reading. `formd` reads and writes to [standard streams](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_streams), so it can be adapted to a wide-range of user workflows. See [this blog post](http://www.drbunsen.org/markdown-formatting/) for further details and workflow examples for using `formd` on the command line, with [Vim](http://www.vim.org/), or with [TextExpander](http://smilesoftware.com/TextExpander/).

## Dependencies:
Python 2.7+

## Installation:
Clone `formd` and place it somewhere in your path:
```bash
$ git clone https://github.com/drbunsen/formd.git ~/bin/
```

## Usage  
There are two command line options for `formd`:  

To generate referenced Markdown use the `-r` flag:  
```bash
$ formd -r
``` 
To generate inline Markdown use the `-i` flag:  
```bash
$ formd -i 
```

`formd` is designed to work with a wide variety of workflows. Here are a few examples:  

#### Use from the command line: 
```bash
$ cat ugly_markdown_file.md | formd -r > reference_formatted_file.md
```  

#### Use within Vim:  
```vim
:%! formd -r
```
or add mappings to your `.vimrc`:
```vim
nmap <leader>fr :%! ~/bin/formd -r<CR>
nmap <leader>fi :%! ~/bin/formd -i<CR>
```

#### Use as a stand alone shell script on with [TextExpander](http://smilesoftware.com/TextExpander/) on OS X:  
```bash
#!/bin/bash
pbpaste | ~/bin/formd -r
```

For more information on `formd` see [this blog post](http://www.drbunsen.org/markdown-formatting/) for additional usage examples and a video demonstration.

Have questions, comments, or suggestions about `formd`? Ask me [@doctorbunsen](http://twitter.com/#!/doctorbunsen).
